description: Each lawyer claimed the other was attacking their client outside of court.

description: So far this tax season, the IRS has received more than 90 million income tax returns for 2022.

title: Trump pauses tariffs on Canada imports for 30 days after doing the same for Mexico
description: Trump agreed to delay tariffs on Canada and Mexico after their leaders agreed to measures to stop the flow of the opioid fentanyl into the U.S.

title: Palantir shares rocket 22% after company posts strong earnings and outlook
description: Palantir's earnings report follows a historic rally in the stock last year.

title: Trump Says Newly Created US Sovereign Wealth Fund Could Buy TikTok
description: U.S. President Donald Trump signed an executive order on Monday ordering the U.S. Treasury and Commerce Departments to create a sovereign wealth fund and said it may purchase TikTok.

title: "Don't Want Chaos": Imran Khan Writes Letter To Pakistan's Army Chief
description: Pakistan Tehreek-e-Insaf (PTI) founder and former Prime Minister Imran Khan has written a letter to Army Chief General Syed Asim Munir, outlining the reasons behind the "growing distance" between the military and the public.

title: With Trump’s Backing Uncertain, Europe Scrambles to Shore Up Its Own Defenses
description: European leaders gathered Monday to plot a rough path forward on defense. Wavering support from President Trump is driving the debate.
author: Jeanna Smialek and Steven Erlanger

title: For China, Trump’s Moves Bring Pain, but Also Potential Gains
description: President Trump’s tariffs hurt China, but his other actions have alienated U.S. allies, giving Beijing an opening to strengthen its global standing.
author: David Pierson, Keith Bradsher and Sui-Lee Wee

title: Trump halts tariffs on Canada and Mexico as both offer new border security plans
description: President Trump granted Mexico and Canada a 30-day reprieve on U.S. tariffs after both nations agreed to intensify efforts to block illicit drugs and migrants.
author: David J. Lynch, Mary Beth Sheridan

title: Stocks pare back losses after Mexico announces delay on Trump tariffs
description: The market swings occurred after President Donald Trump declared levies on goods from Canada, Mexico and China and pledged tariffs on the European Union.
author: Aaron Gregg, Annabelle Timsit, Ellen Francis

title: US halts tariffs on Canada, Mexico for 30 days in last-minute deal
description: US President Donald Trump agreed to pause planned tariffs on Mexico and Canada for 30 days due to steps taken by both countries on border security and drug trafficking. Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau confirmed measures being put in place, while Mexico also reached a similar understanding.
author: TOI World Desk

title: Donald Trump breaks silence on Elon Musk's 'access': 'We won't let him go near...'
description: President Trump on Monday clarified that Elon Musk reports to him and needs administration approval for his actions. Concerns arose as Musk's team gained access to the federal payment system and suggested ending the US Agency for International Development. Trump said Elon Musk won't be allowed to do anything if there is a problem or conflict.
author: TOI World Desk

title: Trump says he will cut off funding to South Africa over land ‘confiscations’
description: Cyril Ramaphosa’s government ‘treating certain classes of people very badly’, says Trump, calling for investigationUS politics live – latest updatesDonald Trump has claimed South Africa is “confiscating” land and “treating certain classes of people very badly”, announcing he is cutting off all future funding to the country pending an investigation.The US president’s intervention into one of South Africa’s most divisive issues was rebutted by the country’s government and criticised by groups across its political spectrum. Continue reading...
author: Rachel Savage in Johannesburg

title: Tiny Nigerian museum marking a forgotten British invasion pushes for recognition
description: Museum in Koko, Niger Delta, commemorates important exiled merchant prince Nanna Olomu – but it has no cooling and a termite issueIn the sleepy Nigerian port town of Koko, the reminder of a forgotten invasion by the British more than a century ago has itself been forgotten.A statue of Nanna Olomu, the Nigerian merchant prince forced into exile by the British in Accra in 1894, stands outside the bungalow where he lived from when he returned in 1906 until his death 10 years later. Officially known as the Nanna Living History Museum, the building was designated a national monument in 1990. Continue reading...
author: Eromo Egbejule in Warri
